As the COVID-19 crisis unfolds, the ACLU of Massachusetts is calling on government officials to implement a response plan grounded in science that protects the health, safety, and civil liberties of all. Here is a quick update on our current work.

Read the ACLU's advocacy response to COVID-19 in Massachusetts.

Public health and legal experts agree that voluntary self-isolation is more likely to induce compliance and trust. To facilitate this, the ACLU of Massachusetts has recommended the following:

  • State government, in conjunction with local and federal government, must ensure equal access to health care, including free and fair coronavirus testing.
  • Government and employers must provide social and economic protection including strong paid family and medical leave policies and income support.
  • The government should take immediate measures to protect vulnerable populations, including those who are incarcerated or experiencing homelessness.

In the spirit of public health and voluntary compliance, the ACLU of Massachusetts is practicing appropriate physical distancing, and our staff are working remotely until further notice. Nevertheless, we are working to ensure that civil rights and civil liberties in the Commonwealth do not take a backseat, especially in a time of crisis.

Read more about the ACLU's response during the COVID-19 crisis in Massachusetts.

In solidarity,
